data.event: Americans began to penetrate the area in the 1750s, and circa 1781 Robert McCrea purchased the land on which Arnold is situated.
The area around Arnold was first settled in 1852 by Major Andrew Arnold, who grew up in Kittanning.

event.title: was separately incorporated as a borough in January 1896

data.event: Arnold was part of New Kensington until it was separately incorporated as a borough in January 1896, and as a third-class city in 1939.
Notable landmarks in Arnold have included: Arnold Station, established in 1867, which was Arnoldâ€™s railroad stop.
